intro: Cheirolophus tagananensis, commonly known as the Taganana larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the island's arid climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
